response.answer_text: It's my first time to hear this word but I googled it up and found that - Article Rewriter is an app that turns existing content into hundreds of unique content. Tsk! I don't know if writers these days would appreciate this. It's just like the case of one who made a template for writing news. Since the creator does not understand reporting, the template he made is of course deficient. It has no place for dates - that is quite important when it comes to news. A group used that template for their reporting on their website. And now all their reports on that website have no dates. The reports keep saying “this year” and “this year” every year, but one cannot tell what year. When the people in charge were told about the lack of dates, they reasoned that they were using a template. They also did not mind because they were writing, but were not schooled as journalists. Article Rewriter? Perhaps people who just need to “write content” would appreciate this. (Yes, content is what “writers” call articles and essays). But not those who need to crack their brains to experience writing as an art that one has to growth up with. Writing involves sacrifice. Your writing grows up with you. There are hurdles that you have to tackle along the way. That's the reason writing sticks with you as you stick with it. Writing is not done with just an application. But for those who need it on the fast lane, perhaps an article rewriter would do. That’s why there is an article rewriter because most probably the article belonged to someone and one needed to rewrite the ideas in it in a different way and presto! There’s another “owner.” If the article indeed belonged to you, you wouldn’t need an application to rewrite it. That’s the logic of this thing. If I were a teacher of today, I would be wary of papers turned in, having merely used an article rewriter. There's actually no substantial work involved with an article rewriter. It's just the churning of an application.

In short, writing cannot rely entirely on writing tools, but it is an indispensable writing aid!
